content.webTitle: Joey Barton's selection for Newcastle is my decision – Alan Pardew

fields.headline: Joey Barton's selection for Newcastle is my decision, says Alan Pardew
fields.bodyText: Alan Pardew will not need to seek boardroom approval if, and it remains a big if, he decides to select Joey Barton for Newcastle United's home game against Arsenal on Saturday. "It's my decision," the manager said. "I'll probably talk to Joey before the start of training on Friday but I'm not sure whether he'll start on Saturday, whatever answer he gives me." Barton, who is available on a free transfer after criticising Newcastle's board via Twitter, is wanted by Stoke and Zenit St Petersburg and must shortly decide whether to stick out the remaining year of his contract on Tyneside or move on. "Only Joey will determine that," Pardew said. "I've said to Joey that he won't play for me and I won't include him unless I think he's pulling for us. He's in the process of weighing up what he needs to do. "I've offered Joey an olive branch – to me his crime wasn't that great – but my dressing room has to be united, we have to fight as one. I think Joey's in a better frame of mind. I think he's beginning to get his head around that it's a difficult decision for him." While Barton remains in limbo, Pardew was delighted to have helped his board and players finally resolve a long-running dispute over bonuses. "I think it's very, very important that we all try and build a new understanding," he said. "It's important that the club and players have agreed there's something in place to reward you for what you do. "I made it [brokering a deal] a big priority. It's important the board and the players are together. At any football club that's what you need. There has to be a mutual respect. Of course, as the manager it's difficult sometimes because you're in the middle. I'm employed by Mike Ashley and Derek Llambias, but my loyalties are just as strong to the players, who I represent and care about and want to try and enhance their careers and make them better players." José Enrique's departure for Liverpool on Thursday is expected to lead to Newcastle making a £7m move for PSV Eindhoven's Dutch international left-back Erik Pieters. Pardew is also seeking an extra striker and is understood to be considering making a bid for Arsenal's Nicklas Bendtner. Should Barton depart, he will also urge Ashley and Llambias to release the funds necessary to sign a new midfielder.
